definitions.definition: the route or direction followed by a ship, aircraft, road, or river.
examples: the road adopts a tortuous course along the coast
synonyms: orbit "the island was not far off our course"

definitions.definition: the way in which something progresses or develops.
a procedure adopted to deal with a situation.
examples: procedure, plan, plan of action, course of action, line of action, MO, modus operandi, practice, approach, technique, way, means, policy, strategy, program; praxis what is the best course to adopt?

definitions.definition: an area of land set aside and prepared for racing, golf, or another sport.
examples: racecourse, raceway, racetrack, track, ground a waterlogged course

definitions.definition: a dish, or a set of dishes served together, forming one of the successive parts of a meal.
examples: guests are offered a choice of main course

definitions.definition: a series of lectures or lessons in a particular subject, typically leading to a qualification.
a series of repeated treatments or doses of medication.
examples: the doctor prescribed a course of antibiotics

definitions.definition: a continuous horizontal layer of brick, stone, or other material in a building.
a pursuit of game (especially hares) with greyhounds by sight rather than scent.
the lowest sail on a square-rigged mast.
a set of adjacent strings on a guitar, lute, etc., tuned to the same note.

examples: tears were coursing down her cheeks

definitions.definition: pursue (game, especially hares) with greyhounds using sight rather than scent.
examples: many of the hares coursed escaped unharmed
